org.fcrepo.kernel.utils

Class NodePropertiesTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.kernel.utils.NodePropertiesTools

  • public class NodePropertiesTools
extends Object
    Tools for replacing, appending and deleting JCR node properties
    Author:
    Chris Beer

    • Method Detail

      • appendOrReplaceNodeProperty

        public void appendOrReplaceNodeProperty(GraphSubjects subjects,
                               javax.jcr.Node node,
                               String propertyName,
                               javax.jcr.Value newValue)
                                 throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Given a JCR node, property and value, either: - if the property is single-valued, replace the existing property with the new value - if the property is multivalued, append the new value to the property
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node
        propertyName - a name of a JCR property (either pre-existing or otherwise)
        newValue - the JCR value to insert
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • removeNodeProperty

        public void removeNodeProperty(GraphSubjects subjects,
                      javax.jcr.Node node,
                      String propertyName,
                      javax.jcr.Value valueToRemove)
                        throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Given a JCR node, property and value, remove the value (if it exists) from the property, and remove the property if no values remove
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node
        propertyName - a name of a JCR property (either pre-existing or otherwise)
        valueToRemove - the JCR value to remove
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • getReferencePropertyName

        public String getReferencePropertyName(String propertyName)
        When we add certain URI properties, we also want to leave a reference node
        Parameters:
        propertyName -
        Returns:

      • getPropertyType

        public int getPropertyType(javax.jcr.Node node,
                  String propertyName)
                    throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Get the JCR property type ID for a given property name. If unsure, mark it as UNDEFINED.
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node to add the property on
        propertyName - the property name
        Returns:
        a PropertyType value
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • isMultivaluedProperty

        public boolean isMultivaluedProperty(javax.jcr.Node node,
                            String propertyName)
                              throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Determine if a given JCR property name is single- or multi- valued. If unsure, choose the least restrictive option (multivalued)
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node to check
        propertyName - the property name (which may or may not already exist)
        Returns:
        true if the property is (or could be) multivalued
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException
